kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_1: The Controller multiblock must fit in a 7x7x7 area.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_2: A Controller block can only touch up to 3 other Controller blocks.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_3: Placing a fourth Controller will disrupt the network.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_4: Something like this is the most efficient design.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_5: This setup has 48 easily-accessible sides, enough for 1536 channels!
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_6: It's highly recommended to use P2P Tunnels.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_7: The middle blocks can each connect to 4 P2P Tunnels!
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_8: Including the center sides, there are 72 faces, enough for 2304 channels!
kubejs.ponder.ae2_multiblock.text_9: Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_1: The ME Controller is the brain of the network.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_10: Color your Cables to keep them separate.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_11: Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_3: Done properly, a single Controller can support 192 channels
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_5: You might think, "Why not just add another Controller wherever?"
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_7: Having two separate Controllers will disrupt the network, shutting the whole thing down.
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_8: However, placing Controllers together will form a multiblock!
kubejs.ponder.ae2_single.text_9: The more faces, the more channels!
kubejs.ponder.boiler_construction.text_1: The Thermoelectric Boiler uses Heat to turn Water into Steam.
Additional Heater layers are optional, but make it run faster and hold more Water.
Hollow layers (called Water Cavity layers) can optionally be included, to hold more Water.
Fill a layer with Pressure Dispersers to create a "Steam Catch layer." The entire layer must be filled.
Hollow layers (called Steam Cavity layers) can optionally be included, to hold more Steam
Cap it off, and you're almost done!
Replace two blocks on the casing on a Heater or Water Cavity layer with Valves.
One acts as a Water input...
Replace a block on the casing on a Steam Catch or Steam Cavity layer with another Valve.
This will act as the Steam output.
kubejs.ponder.boiler_construction.text_2: Its design is modular, here's how you make it.
And that's it! Your Boiler is now ready to run!
Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
kubejs.ponder.boiler_construction.text_3: The Boiler can be anywhere from a 3x4x3 to 18x18x18.
kubejs.ponder.boiler_construction.text_6: Fill the next layer with Superheating Elements.
kubejs.ponder.boiler_construction.text_7: Surround this layer with Boiler Casing.
kubejs.ponder.boiler_construction.text_8: This layer is now a "Heater layer."
kubejs.ponder.boiler_construction.text_9: The non-corners can be Structural Glass instead
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_1: The Dynamic Tank is a modular multiblock that stores a fluid.
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_3: Make a cuboid frame out of Dynamic Tank blocks...
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_4: ...and fill the sides with either more Tank blocks or Structural Glass.
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_5: For every block that makes up the Tank (including edges), the Tank can hold 16 buckets of fluid.
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_6: The smallest Tank (3x3x3) holds 432 buckets, and the largest Tank (18x18x18) holds 93,312.
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_7: Replace two blocks with Dynamic Valves.
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_8: That really is it! Your tank is now ready!
kubejs.ponder.dt_construction.text_9: Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
kubejs.ponder.fission_construction.text_: The Fission Generator is a multiblock that generates a massive amount of heat.
Fill the walls with Reactor Glass (or more Reactor Casing).
Place a pillar of Fusion Fuel Assemblies anywhere inside
The more you put, the faster the Reactor burns fuel.
On top of the pillar, place a Control Rod Assembly.
This must be BELOW the Reactor's top, not part of it.
There can be multiple sets of Control Rods, but they cannot touch sides.
Anywhere on any of the sides, place 4 Fission Reactor Ports:
One for Fuel input
One for Coolant input
One for Heated Coolant output
It does this by coolant (like Water)...
And one for Radioactive Waste output
And now your Fission Reactor is complete!
Running it is VERY dangerous though, so make sure to read the quests explaining it!
Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
...into something hotter (like Steam).
Fueled by Fissile Fuel..
...it creates dangerous Radioactive Waste as a byproduct.
This is how it's built.
It can be anywhere from 3x4x3 to 18x18x18
Build the frame out of Fission Reactor Casing
Cap the top and bottom as well.
kubejs.ponder.fusion_construction.text_1: Mekanism's Fusion Reactor can make an extreme amount of FE/t.
kubejs.ponder.fusion_construction.text_3: Use "Q" to see what each block is.
kubejs.ponder.fusion_construction.text_4: Any Frames that aren't on a corner can be replaced with Reactor Glass
kubejs.ponder.fusion_construction.text_5: Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
kubejs.ponder.induction_construction.tex: The Induction Matrix is a modular multiblock that stores FE.
A max sized Matrix with the most Cells possible could store 6,552,000,000,000,000 FE!
Close it back up (air inside is fine)
FE is piped into the input Induction Port...
Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
It must be a rectangular prism, but it can be anywhere from 3x3x4 to 18x18x18
The edges must be made out of Induction Casing...
...but the centers can have Induction Ports anywhere inside.
An Induction Provider must be placed anywhere inside.
Having more Induction Providers, or Providers of higher tiers, increases the rate FE can move in and out.
An Induction Cell must also be placed anywhere inside.
More Cells, or Cells of higher tiers, increase the capacity of the Matrix.
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_1: The SPS turns energy and Polonium into Antimatter.
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_12: Any Port can be anywhere inside any circle.
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_13: The Supercharged Coil has to be on the Port that accepts power.
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_14: The two can be placed on the sides as well
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_15: The more powered Coils, the faster Antimatter is created!
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_16: Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_3: Basically, six 7-wide circles of SPS Casing with stuff inside
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_4: The inside of the circle can be made of any of these:
kubejs.ponder.sps_construction.text_8: Three SPS Ports must be placed inside any of the circles.
kubejs.ponder.turbine_construction.text_: The Industrial Turbine is a multiblock that uses Steam to generate massive amounts of FE.
The walls can be made of Structural Glass, but the corners must be Turbine Casing.
Place a Rotational Complex on the Rotors...
...and completely fill the rest of that layer with Pressure Dispersers.
The more room under this layer, the more Steam the Turbine can hold.
Place an Electromagnetic Coil on the Rotational Complex.
The amount of Coils (and of Rotor Blades) is what decides how much FE is generated.
You can have multiple layers of Coil.
Finish up the walls with Turbine Vents.
The amount of Vents (and of Presssure Dispersers) is what decides the flow rate.
Higher flow rate means more Steam is used, and more FE is produced.
This is how it's built.
Place a Valve for Steam input...
...and another for FE output!
Ponder originally made for FTB University 1.19!
First, place a base of Casing.
It can be anywhere from 5x5 to 17x17.
Place some Rotors in the middle.
The wider your Turbine, the taller it can be.
Attach Turbine Blades
If the Blades reach out far enough they would go through the walls...
...then you have to make the Turbine either shorter or wider.
